fr.epita.sp18.rest

Class IdentityController

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.epita.sp18.rest.IdentityController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/api/identities")
public class IdentityController
extends java.lang.Object
    API /api/identities is the interface of IAM-Project with external application.

    To make calls to this API, you need to send the API token in a Authorization HTTP header using the Bearer authentication scheme. API token can be acquired via sign in thru URL /login

    Author:
    Philip

    • Method Detail

      • delete

        @DeleteMapping(value="/{uid}")
public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> delete(@PathVariable(value="uid")
                                                                            java.lang.Long uid)
        DELETE /api/identities/1531171542822. Delete the identity base on its primary key
        Parameters:
        uid - An unique id of the identity. Integer 64 bits
        Returns:
        Delete result.

        Http response sample when delete record successfully: {model: null, message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: ""}.

        Http response sample when there is error: {model: null, message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: "Error when deleting identity. Please try again"}

      • get

        @GetMapping(value="/{uid}")
public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> get(@PathVariable(value="uid")
                                                                      java.lang.Long uid)
        GET /api/identities/1531171542822. Get information of an identity base on its primary key
        Parameters:
        uid - An unique id of the identity. Integer 64 bits
        Returns:
        Search result.

        Http response sample: {model: { email : "hugo@email.com" name : "Hugo Lloris" uid : 1531171542822}, message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: ""}.

        Http response sample when no identity found: {model: null, message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: ""}

      • list

        @GetMapping
public ApiResponse<java.util.List<IdentityResponse>> list(@RequestParam(value="filter")
                                                                       java.lang.String filter)
        GET /api/identities?filter=xyz. Search for identities name or email that contain keyword specified in "filter" parameter
        Parameters:
        filter - the keyword for searching. Sample API that search for identities containing the keyword "go": /api/identities?filter=go
        Returns:
        Search result. Http response sample: {model: [{uid: 1531171542822, name: "Hugo Lloris", email: "hugo@email.com"}], message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: ""}. Http response sample when no identity found: {model: null, message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: ""}

      • create

        @PostMapping
public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> create(@RequestBody
                                                          IdentityRequest request)
        POST /api/identities. Create a new identity according to the parameter received in post http request body
        Parameters:
        request - The identity in JSON format. Sample request body: {"uid": 0, "name":"Admin", "email":"admin@email.com", "password":"Admin1234"}
        Returns:
        Create result. Http response sample: {model: {uid: 1531171542822, name: "Hugo Lloris", email: "hugo@email.com"}, message: "", hasError: false, errorMessage: ""}. Http response sample when creating identity has error: {model: {uid: 1531171542822, name: "Hugo Lloris", email: "hugo@email.com"}, message: "", hasError: true, errorMessage: "This email is already used. Choose a new one"}. Detail error can be found in server's log.

      • update

        @PutMapping(value="/{uid}")
public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> update(@RequestBody
                                                                         IdentityRequest request)
        PUT /api/identities/1531171542822. Update identity according to the data received in http request body
        Parameters:
        request - Same as POST request value
        Returns:
        Update result. Http response is same as POST request

      • patch

        @PatchMapping(value="/{uid}")
public ApiResponse<IdentityResponse> patch(@RequestBody
                                                                          IdentityRequest request)
        PATCH /api/identities/1531171542822. Update identity according to the data received in http request body, EXCEPT the password property
        Parameters:
        request - Same as POST request value
        Returns:
        Patch result. Http response is same as POST request
